content.text:
I wonder how much value would be lost if we dropped the whole `package.json` dependencies thing and just parse the files so you can do something like:

```js
const debug = require.version('debug', '4.1.x')
```

This has the benefit/footgun of being able to have different versions of modules in each file, but otherwise it seems way nicer than having to maintain dependencies in `package.json`.
